about_the_game:
The Liminal Theory | Synopsis


What are liminal spaces? What happens when these places collide with each other?
Dive into this third-person adventure to explore The Liminal Theory in unique environments like Backrooms and Pools. Encounter creatures born from Limen & Chaos and explore incredible places.

Chaos & Limen | Story


Embark on this third-person game centered around liminal spaces.
A paranormal event has caused all liminal spaces to collide, creating a fracture. You might not be the first sent to investigate this fracture, but you could be the only one capable of understanding what happened.

This fracture has introduced two new physical elements: "Chaos" and "Limen." What is their significance in The Liminal Theory? It will be your task to uncover the truth.

Liminal Journey | Unique Gameplay Features


As you explore these liminal spaces, searching for answers, you'll encounter creatures from Limen and creatures from Chaos, both born from this fracture.

  • The game is primarily in third person, but you can enable a first-person view.

  • Choose to play in standard mode or with the "Body Cam VHS" filter.



Unique Creatures Designed for the Game

  • Encounter unique liminal creatures born from "Chaos."
  • Encounter unique liminal creatures born from "Limen."
  • Classic and Unique Liminal Environments: Travel through well-known liminal spaces such as "Backrooms," "Pools," and others, and discover new or altered liminal areas influenced by Chaos and Limen.



Exploration and Gameplay

  • Meet other explorers lost within these liminal spaces: some may be persuaded to follow you. Save them.

  • Face various enemies: Don't worry, you'll have the means to fight back! Stun or even eliminate them.

  • Interconnected level design: each area is linked, with secret zones to discover through careful exploration and various shortcuts.

Stay tuned for more information, videos, and images throughout the year!

Sensitive Content and Photosensitivity Warning:


The Liminal Theory contains strobing and flashing lights that could trigger seizures in a small percentage of individuals when exposed to certain lights, patterns, or images. This game also contains graphic content.

All screenshots were taken with the photo mode available in the game!
